005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.simulation;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.VecBuilder;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N2;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.system.LinearSystem;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.system.NumericalIntegration;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.system.plant.DCMotor;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.system.plant.LinearSystemId;
015
016/** Represents a simulated single jointed arm mechanism. */
017public class SingleJointedArmSim extends LinearSystemSim<N2, N1, N1> {
018  // The gearbox for the arm.
019  private final DCMotor m_gearbox;
020
021  // The gearing between the motors and the output.
022  private final double m_gearing;
023
024  // The length of the arm.
025  private final double m_r;
026
027  // The minimum angle that the arm is capable of.
028  private final double m_minAngle;
029
030  // The maximum angle that the arm is capable of.
031  private final double m_maxAngle;
032
033  // The mass of the arm.
034  private final double m_armMass;
035
036  // Whether the simulator should simulate gravity.
037  private final boolean m_simulateGravity;
038
039  /**
040   * Creates a simulated arm mechanism.
041   *
042   * @param plant The linear system that represents the arm.
043   * @param gearbox The type of and number of motors in the arm gearbox.
044   * @param gearing The gearing of the arm (numbers greater than 1 represent reductions).
045   * @param armLengthMeters The length of the arm.
046   * @param minAngleRads The minimum angle that the arm is capable of.
047   * @param maxAngleRads The maximum angle that the arm is capable of.
048   * @param armMassKg The mass of the arm.
049   * @param simulateGravity Whether gravity should be simulated or not.
050   */
051  public SingleJointedArmSim(
052      LinearSystem<N2, N1, N1> plant,
053      DCMotor gearbox,
054      double gearing,
055      double armLengthMeters,
056      double minAngleRads,
057      double maxAngleRads,
058      double armMassKg,
059      boolean simulateGravity) {
060    this(
061        plant,
062        gearbox,
063        gearing,
064        armLengthMeters,
065        minAngleRads,
066        maxAngleRads,
067        armMassKg,
068        simulateGravity,
069        null);
070  }
071
072  /**
073   * Creates a simulated arm mechanism.
074   *
075   * @param plant The linear system that represents the arm.
076   * @param gearbox The type of and number of motors in the arm gearbox.
077   * @param gearing The gearing of the arm (numbers greater than 1 represent reductions).
078   * @param armLengthMeters The length of the arm.
079   * @param minAngleRads The minimum angle that the arm is capable of.
080   * @param maxAngleRads The maximum angle that the arm is capable of.
081   * @param armMassKg The mass of the arm.
082   * @param simulateGravity Whether gravity should be simulated or not.
083   * @param measurementStdDevs The standard deviations of the measurements.
084   */
085  public SingleJointedArmSim(
086      LinearSystem<N2, N1, N1> plant,
087      DCMotor gearbox,
088      double gearing,
089      double armLengthMeters,
090      double minAngleRads,
091      double maxAngleRads,
092      double armMassKg,
093      boolean simulateGravity,
094      Matrix<N1, N1> measurementStdDevs) {
095    super(plant, measurementStdDevs);
096    m_gearbox = gearbox;
097    m_gearing = gearing;
098    m_r = armLengthMeters;
099    m_minAngle = minAngleRads;
100    m_maxAngle = maxAngleRads;
101    m_armMass = armMassKg;
102    m_simulateGravity = simulateGravity;
103  }
104
105  /**
106   * Creates a simulated arm mechanism.
107   *
108   * @param gearbox The type of and number of motors in the arm gearbox.
109   * @param gearing The gearing of the arm (numbers greater than 1 represent reductions).
110   * @param jKgMetersSquared The moment of inertia of the arm, can be calculated from CAD software.
111   * @param armLengthMeters The length of the arm.
112   * @param minAngleRads The minimum angle that the arm is capable of.
113   * @param maxAngleRads The maximum angle that the arm is capable of.
114   * @param armMassKg The mass of the arm.
115   * @param simulateGravity Whether gravity should be simulated or not.
116   */
117  public SingleJointedArmSim(
118      DCMotor gearbox,
119      double gearing,
120      double jKgMetersSquared,
121      double armLengthMeters,
122      double minAngleRads,
123      double maxAngleRads,
124      double armMassKg,
125      boolean simulateGravity) {
126    this(
127        gearbox,
128        gearing,
129        jKgMetersSquared,
130        armLengthMeters,
131        minAngleRads,
132        maxAngleRads,
133        armMassKg,
134        simulateGravity,
135        null);
136  }
137
138  /**
139   * Creates a simulated arm mechanism.
140   *
141   * @param gearbox The type of and number of motors in the arm gearbox.
142   * @param gearing The gearing of the arm (numbers greater than 1 represent reductions).
143   * @param jKgMetersSquared The moment of inertia of the arm; can be calculated from CAD software.
144   * @param armLengthMeters The length of the arm.
145   * @param minAngleRads The minimum angle that the arm is capable of.
146   * @param maxAngleRads The maximum angle that the arm is capable of.
147   * @param armMassKg The mass of the arm.
148   * @param simulateGravity Whether gravity should be simulated or not.
149   * @param measurementStdDevs The standard deviations of the measurements.
150   */
151  public SingleJointedArmSim(
152      DCMotor gearbox,
153      double gearing,
154      double jKgMetersSquared,
155      double armLengthMeters,
156      double minAngleRads,
157      double maxAngleRads,
158      double armMassKg,
159      boolean simulateGravity,
160      Matrix<N1, N1> measurementStdDevs) {
161    super(
162        LinearSystemId.createSingleJointedArmSystem(gearbox, jKgMetersSquared, gearing),
163        measurementStdDevs);
164    m_gearbox = gearbox;
165    m_gearing = gearing;
166    m_r = armLengthMeters;
167    m_minAngle = minAngleRads;
168    m_maxAngle = maxAngleRads;
169    m_armMass = armMassKg;
170    m_simulateGravity = simulateGravity;
171  }
172
173  /**
174   * Returns whether the arm would hit the lower limit.
175   *
176   * @param currentAngleRads The current arm height.
177   * @return Whether the arm would hit the lower limit.
178   */
179  public boolean wouldHitLowerLimit(double currentAngleRads) {
180    return currentAngleRads <= this.m_minAngle;
181  }
182
183  /**
184   * Returns whether the arm would hit the upper limit.
185   *
186   * @param currentAngleRads The current arm height.
187   * @return Whether the arm would hit the upper limit.
188   */
189  public boolean wouldHitUpperLimit(double currentAngleRads) {
190    return currentAngleRads >= this.m_maxAngle;
191  }
192
193  /**
194   * Returns whether the arm has hit the lower limit.
195   *
196   * @return Whether the arm has hit the lower limit.
197   */
198  public boolean hasHitLowerLimit() {
199    return wouldHitLowerLimit(getAngleRads());
200  }
201
202  /**
203   * Returns whether the arm has hit the upper limit.
204   *
205   * @return Whether the arm has hit the upper limit.
206   */
207  public boolean hasHitUpperLimit() {
208    return wouldHitUpperLimit(getAngleRads());
209  }
210
211  /**
212   * Returns the current arm angle.
213   *
214   * @return The current arm angle.
215   */
216  public double getAngleRads() {
217    return m_y.get(0, 0);
218  }
219
220  /**
221   * Returns the current arm velocity.
222   *
223   * @return The current arm velocity.
224   */
225  public double getVelocityRadPerSec() {
226    return m_x.get(1, 0);
227  }
228
229  /**
230   * Returns the arm current draw.
231   *
232   * @return The aram current draw.
233   */
234  @Override
235  public double getCurrentDrawAmps() {
236    // Reductions are greater than 1, so a reduction of 10:1 would mean the motor is
237    // spinning 10x faster than the output
238    var motorVelocity = m_x.get(1, 0) * m_gearing;
239    return m_gearbox.getCurrent(motorVelocity, m_u.get(0, 0)) * Math.signum(m_u.get(0, 0));
240  }
241
242  /**
243   * Sets the input voltage for the arm.
244   *
245   * @param volts The input voltage.
246   */
247  public void setInputVoltage(double volts) {
248    setInput(volts);
249  }
250
251  /**
252   * Calculates a rough estimate of the moment of inertia of an arm given its length and mass.
253   *
254   * @param lengthMeters The length of the arm.
255   * @param massKg The mass of the arm.
256   * @return The calculated moment of inertia.
257   */
258  public static double estimateMOI(double lengthMeters, double massKg) {
259    return 1.0 / 3.0 * massKg * lengthMeters * lengthMeters;
260  }
261
262  /**
263   * Updates the state of the arm.
264   *
265   * @param currentXhat The current state estimate.
266   * @param u The system inputs (voltage).
267   * @param dtSeconds The time difference between controller updates.
268   */
269  @Override
270  protected Matrix<N2, N1> updateX(Matrix<N2, N1> currentXhat, Matrix<N1, N1> u, double dtSeconds) {
271    // Horizontal case:
272    // Torque = F * r = I * alpha
273    // alpha = F * r / I
274    // Since F = mg,
275    // alpha = m * g * r / I
276    // Finally, multiply RHS by cos(theta) to account for the arm angle
277    // This acceleration is added to the linear system dynamics x-dot = Ax + Bu
278    // We therefore find that f(x, u) = Ax + Bu + [[0] [m * g * r / I *
279    // cos(theta)]]
280    Matrix<N2, N1> updatedXhat =
281        NumericalIntegration.rkdp(
282            (Matrix<N2, N1> x, Matrix<N1, N1> _u) -> {
283              Matrix<N2, N1> xdot = m_plant.getA().times(x).plus(m_plant.getB().times(_u));
284              if (m_simulateGravity) {
285                xdot =
286                    xdot.plus(
287                        VecBuilder.fill(
288                            0,
289                            m_armMass
290                                * m_r
291                                * -9.8
292                                * 3.0
293                                / (m_armMass * m_r * m_r)
294                                * Math.cos(x.get(0, 0))));
295              }
296              return xdot;
297            },
298            currentXhat,
299            u,
300            dtSeconds);
301
302    // We check for collision after updating xhat
303    if (wouldHitLowerLimit(updatedXhat.get(0, 0))) {
304      return VecBuilder.fill(m_minAngle, 0);
305    }
306    if (wouldHitUpperLimit(updatedXhat.get(0, 0))) {
307      return VecBuilder.fill(m_maxAngle, 0);
308    }
309    return updatedXhat;
310  }
311}
